trans-unit.source: Provides methods used to render a tab control with visual styles.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer> class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a tab control with the current visual style of the operating system.
Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control.
This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should have the appearance of the current visual style.

To draw a tab control, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> method to draw the page, and use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> method to draw each tab.

If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows, the methods of this class will draw the tab control with the current visual style.
Otherwise, the methods and properties of this class will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
To determine whether the members of this class can be used, check the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property.

This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Tab?displayProperty=fullName> class.
For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/rendering-controls-with-visual-styles.md).
Draws a tab in the specified state and bounds.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the tab.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the tab.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.TabItemState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the tab.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Draws a tab in the specified state and bounds, and with an optional focus rectangle.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the tab.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the tab.
`true` to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, `false`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.TabItemState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the tab.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-

Draws a tab page in the specified bounds.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the tab page.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the tab page.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer"></xref> class can be used to draw a tab control with visual styles.

If this property is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
`true` if the user has enabled visual styles in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows; otherwise, `false`.
